Metadata.title: SBOMHub - Open Source SBOM Management Platform
Metadata.description: SBOMHub is an open-source SBOM management platform providing CycloneDX/SPDX import, vulnerability management, VEX statement creation, and compliance checking. Optimized for the Japanese market.
Metadata.keywords: SBOM, Software Bill of Materials, vulnerability management, CycloneDX, SPDX, VEX, software supply chain, security, compliance, open source
Metadata.ogTitle: SBOMHub - Manage Your Software Bill of Materials
Metadata.ogDescription: Open-source SBOM management platform with CycloneDX/SPDX import, vulnerability management, and VEX support. Start your 14-day free trial.
Metadata.twitterDescription: Strengthen your software supply chain security. Centralize SBOM management, vulnerability detection, and VEX support.

hero.title:
Manage Your Software
Bill of Materials
hero.description: SBOMHub is an SBOM management platform that provides CycloneDX/SPDX import, vulnerability management, VEX statement creation, and compliance checking.

features.title: Key Features
features.description: Everything you need for software supply chain security

import.title: SBOM Import
import.description: Import SBOM files in CycloneDX and SPDX formats. Compatible with major tools like Syft, cdxgen, and Trivy.

vulnerability.title: Vulnerability Management
vulnerability.description: Automatically detect component vulnerabilities with NVD database integration. View by severity level.

vex.title: VEX Statements
vex.description: Create and manage Vulnerability Exploitability eXchange (VEX) statements. Record false positive exclusions and response status.

compliance.title: Compliance
compliance.description: Self-assessment feature to support METI (Japan) SBOM guideline response. Note: This is not an official compliance certification.

license.title: License Management
license.description: Automatic OSS license detection and policy checking. Prevent license conflicts and usage violations.

cicd.title: CI/CD Integration
cicd.description: Upload SBOMs via API from CI/CD pipelines like GitHub Actions.

i18n.title: Multilingual
i18n.description: Optimized for the Japanese market. UI supports both Japanese and English.

ipa.title: IPA Integration
ipa.description: Integrate with IPA (Japan Information-technology Promotion Agency) security alerts. Auto-fetch domestic vulnerability information.

diff.title: SBOM Diff Comparison
diff.description: Compare SBOMs across versions to detect added, removed, and updated components along with new vulnerabilities.

pricing.title: Pricing Plans
pricing.description: Choose a plan that fits your team size. Start with a free trial.
pricing.currencyNote: All prices are in JPY (Japanese Yen)

cta.title: Start Managing Your SBOMs Today
cta.description: Strengthen your software supply chain security. Try all features free for 14 days.

footer.description: Open-source platform for managing and visualizing Software Bill of Materials (SBOM)

Home.title: SBOMHub
Home.description: Open-source platform for managing and visualizing SBOMs

ProjectDetail.uploadDescription: Upload a CycloneDX or SPDX JSON file
ProjectDetail.noComponents: No components found. Upload an SBOM first.
ProjectDetail.noVexStatements: No VEX statements found. Add VEX statements from the Vulnerabilities tab.
ProjectDetail.noLicensePolicies: No license policies configured. Add policies to check component licenses.
ProjectDetail.apiKeyCopyWarning: Copy this key now. You won't be able to see it again.
ProjectDetail.apiKeyUseCasesDescription: API keys can be used for:
ProjectDetail.apiKeyUseCli: CLI: Login with sbomhub login --api-key YOUR_KEY
ProjectDetail.apiKeyUseCicd: CI/CD: Auto-upload SBOMs from GitHub Actions, etc.
ProjectDetail.apiKeyEnvDescription: Use this as the environment variable name
ProjectDetail.noApiKeys: No API keys created. Create a key to enable CLI, MCP Server, and CI/CD integration.
ProjectDetail.apiKeyMigrationDescription: API keys are now managed at the tenant level instead of per-project. You can create a single API key that works across all projects in the settings page.
ProjectDetail.emailAddressesDescription: Separate multiple email addresses with commas. For Teams forwarding, use a Power Automate email address.
ProjectDetail.severityThresholdsDescription: Select which severity levels trigger notifications
ProjectDetail.deleteApiKeyConfirm: Delete this API key? This action cannot be undone.

VexForm.vulnerableCodeNotInExecutePath: Vulnerable code not in execute path
VexForm.vulnerableCodeCannotBeControlled: Vulnerable code cannot be controlled by adversary
VexForm.impactPlaceholder: Describe the impact of this vulnerability...

LicenseForm.title: Add License Policy
LicenseForm.reasonPlaceholder: Explain why this policy was set...

Dashboard.title: Dashboard
Dashboard.topEpssDescription: Vulnerabilities most likely to be exploited

KEV.title: CISA KEV Catalog
KEV.description: This vulnerability is listed in CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities catalog and is actively exploited in the wild.
KEV.ransomwareWarning: Known to be used in ransomware attacks

SSVC.title: SSVC Assessment
SSVC.subtitle: Stakeholder-Specific Vulnerability Categorization
SSVC.description: Vulnerability prioritization based on CISA's SSVC framework

decisionDescription.immediate: Stop all other work and address this vulnerability immediately
decisionDescription.out_of_cycle: Address this vulnerability outside of your regular update cycle as soon as possible
decisionDescription.scheduled: Plan to address this vulnerability during your next regular maintenance cycle
decisionDescription.defer: No action required at this time. Continue monitoring the situation

exploitationDescription.none: No exploit code or PoC has been identified
exploitationDescription.poc: Proof of concept exploit code is publicly available
exploitationDescription.active: Active exploitation has been observed in the wild

automatableDescription.no: Manual intervention is required for exploitation

technicalImpactDescription.partial: Some functionality or data is affected
technicalImpactDescription.total: Complete control of the system may be compromised

missionPrevalenceDescription.minimal: Affected systems have little relevance to the mission
missionPrevalenceDescription.essential: Affected systems are essential to the mission

safetyImpactDescription.significant: May significantly impact human life or safety

defaults.title: SSVC Default Settings
defaults.description: Configure default SSVC parameter values for this project

CreateTicket.title: Create Ticket
CreateTicket.createDescription: Create a ticket to address this vulnerability

Analytics.title: Trend Analysis
Analytics.sloDescription: Shows the percentage of vulnerabilities resolved within SLO target time. Critical: 24 hours, High: 7 days, Medium: 30 days, Low: 90 days
Analytics.noDataDescription: Trend analysis will be displayed as vulnerability detection and resolution data accumulates.

Reports.title: Reports
Reports.description: Generate and manage executive, technical, and compliance reports
Reports.noReportsDescription: Create a new report using the "Generate Report" button.

Search.title: Cross Search
Search.cveSearchDescription: Search all projects for a specific CVE ID to identify impact scope
Search.componentSearchDescription: Search all projects by component name and version

Audit.title: Audit Logs
Audit.proFeatureMessage: Audit logs are available on Pro plan and above.

Billing.title: Plans & Billing
Billing.manualSyncRequired: Please enter the subscription ID manually
Billing.manualSyncDescription: Check the subscription ID from Lemon Squeezy dashboard and enter it below.
Billing.selfHostedDescription: All features are unlimited in self-hosted mode.
Billing.selectPlanPromptDescription: You need to select a plan to use SBOMHub. You can also start with the free plan.

MCPDocs.title: MCP Server Integration Guide
MCPDocs.description: Access SBOMHub vulnerability information using natural language from Claude Desktop or Cursor.
MCPDocs.whatIsMcpDescription: MCP is a standard protocol that allows AI tools like Claude Desktop and Cursor to integrate with external services. Once you configure the SBOMHub MCP Server, you can check your project's vulnerability information just by talking to Claude.
MCPDocs.whatIsMcpExample: Example: Just say "Search for projects affected by CVE-2021-44228" to instantly check the impact of Log4Shell.
MCPDocs.step1Item4: Click "Create API Key" and copy the displayed key (sbh_...)
MCPDocs.step1Item2Revised: Go to Settings > API Keys in the sidebar
MCPDocs.step1Item3Revised: Click "Create API Key" and copy the displayed key (sbh_...)
MCPDocs.step4Description: Restart Claude Desktop / Cursor to enable SBOMHub tools.
MCPDocs.toolSearchCve: Cross-search all projects by CVE ID
MCPDocs.toolDiff: Compare two SBOMs and get the diff
MCPDocs.toolGetVulnerabilities: Get vulnerability list for a project
MCPDocs.usageExamplesDescription: Just talk to Claude to get information
MCPDocs.example3: "Show me the Critical vulnerabilities in my-app project"
MCPDocs.example5: "Check the compliance score for my project"
MCPDocs.error1Solution: The environment variable SBOMHUB_API_KEY is not set. Check your configuration file.
MCPDocs.error2Solution: Make sure pnpm build succeeded, dist/index.js exists, the path in config is correct, then restart the app.
MCPDocs.error3Solution: Check if the API key is correct, not expired, and the SBOMHub URL is correct.

Integrations.title: Integration Settings
Integrations.description: Configure integrations with issue tracking systems like Jira and Backlog
Integrations.enterConnectionInfo: Enter connection information for the issue tracking system
Integrations.noIntegrationsDescription: Connect with Jira or Backlog to create tickets directly from vulnerabilities
Integrations.deleteDescription: This action cannot be undone. Tickets created with this integration will not be affected, but you won't be able to create new tickets.
Integrations.step1Description: Set up a connection to Jira or Backlog using the form above. You'll need an API token.
Integrations.step2Description: Click the "Create Ticket" button from the vulnerability list or detail page to create an issue.
Integrations.step3Description: Ticket status is automatically synced. When an issue is resolved, the vulnerability status is also updated.

Scan.title: Periodic Scan Settings
Scan.notificationDescription: Notify when vulnerabilities of the selected severity or higher are detected

Reports.title: Report Settings
Reports.description: Configure automatic report generation schedule and delivery settings
Reports.emailDeliveryDescription: Automatically send email after report generation

IPA.title: IPA Integration Settings
IPA.description: Automatically fetch security information from IPA (Information-technology Promotion Agency, Japan)
IPA.syncSettingsDescription: Configure automatic fetching of IPA security alerts and JVN vulnerability information
IPA.autoSyncInterval: Fetch the latest IPA/JVN information every 6 hours
IPA.notificationSettingsDescription: Configure notifications for new security information
IPA.notifyOnNewDescription: Receive notifications when new security information is published
IPA.ipaSecurityAlertDescription: Important security information and emergency advisories
IPA.jvnVulnerabilityInfoDescription: Vulnerability information database from Japan Vulnerability Notes

APIKeys.title: API Keys
APIKeys.description: Manage API keys for CLI, MCP Server, and CI/CD integrations
APIKeys.createDescription: Create an API key for CLI, MCP Server, or CI/CD pipelines
APIKeys.keyCreatedDescription: This key will only be shown once. Save it in a secure location.
APIKeys.keyWarning: If you lose this key, you will need to create a new one. Existing keys cannot be displayed again.
APIKeys.permissionsHelp: Read only allows data retrieval, Read/Write also allows SBOM uploads
APIKeys.noKeysDescription: API keys are required for CLI, MCP Server, and CI/CD integrations
APIKeys.deleteDescription: This action cannot be undone. Integrations using this key will stop working.
APIKeys.usageDescription: Use your API key with the following integrations
